name: Otto I
JA_events:
Ended the Hungarian invasions of Western Europe|
Conquered Northern Italy|
Invaded papal states and installed Leo VIII as pope
JA_relationships:
Byzantine Empire, Theophanu, Daughter-in-law, img/byzantine/theophano.jpeg|
Italy, Adelaide, Wife, img/italy/adelaide.jpg|
England, Edward the Elder, Father-in-law, img/england/edward_the_elder.jpg

name: Otto II
JA_events:
Subjugated and christianized the Danes|
Attempted and failed to take Italy from the Muslims
JA_wars:
Emirate of Sicily, 982|
Great Slav Rising, 983
JA_relationships: Byzantine Empire, Theophanu, Wife, img/byzantine/theophano.jpeg

name: Otto III
JA_events:
Lost territories east of the Elbe to Slavs|
Died without heir, causing Italy to break away

name: Henry II
JA_events:
Crowned King of Germany following death of Otto III|
Added Bohemia to the empire|
Support for Rome led to the East-West Schism of the Church

name: Conrad II
JA_events:
Claimed the vacant Dukedom of Bavaria|
Incorporated the heirless Kingdom of Burgundy

name: Henry III
JA_events:
Given Bavaria, Swabia, and Burgundy from father Conrad II|
Trial of Italian bishop precipitated Investiture Controversy|
Split Lorraine into Upper and Lower Lorraine
JA_relationships:
Aquitaine, Agnes, Wife, img/france/agnes.jpg|
Denmark, Cnut the Great, Father-in-law, img/denmark/cnut_the_great.jpg

name: Henry IV
JA_events:
Attempted to appoint bishops instead of the papacy|
Excommunicated 5 times during Investiture Controversy|
Defeated by son Henry with support of papacy
JA_relationships:
Savoy, Bertha, Wife, img/italy/bertha.jpg|
Russia, Vsevolod I, Father-in-law, img/russia/vsevolod.jpg

name: Henry V
JA_events:
Captured Pope Paschal II|
Settled Investiture Controversy in Concordat of Worms
JA_relationships: England, Henry I, Father-in-law, img/england/henry_i.png

name: Lothair II
JA_events:
Appointed Duke of Saxony for supporting Henry V against father|
First elected Emperor without hereditary claim|

name: Frederick I
JA_events:
Created feudal court via Landfrieden of 1152|
Defeated at Alessandria by pro-papal Lombard League|
Reconciled with Pope Alexander II at Peace of Venice
JA_relationships: Sicily, Constance, Daughter-in-law, img/italy/constance.jpg

name: Henry VI
JA_events:
Captured and ransomed Richard the Lionheart of England|
Captured and added Sicily to the Empire|
Attempted and failed to make imperial crown hereditary
JA_relationships: Sicily, Constance, Wife, img/italy/constance.jpg

name: Otto IV
JA_events:
Son of anti-king Henry the Lion|
Excommunicated by Pope Innocent III|
Frederick II elected concurrently by dissatisfied princes and Pope
JA_relationships: England, Henry II, Grandfather, img/england/henry_ii.png

name: Frederick II
JA_events:
Appointed king of Sicily and Jerusalem through marriage|
Outlawed the practice of Trial by Ordeal|
After death, Empire entered a period of long decline
JA_wars:
Fifth Crusade, 1217-21|
Sixth Crusade, 1228-9|
Guelphs and Ghibellines, 1241
JA_relationships:
Sicily, Roger II, Father-in-law, img/italy/roger_ii.jpg|
Aragon, Alfonso II, Father-in-law, img/spain/alfonso_ii.jpg

name: Henry VII
JA_events:
Elected over French Charles of Valois as King of the Romans|
Swung support amongst Italians to pro-Empire Ghibelline faction|
Coronation ended the Great Interregnum of the empire
JA_relationships: France, Charles IV, Son-in-law, img/france/charles_iv_and_i.jpg

name: Louis IV
JA_events:
Elected over Habsburg cousin with support of Luxembourgs|
Gave Teutonic Knights permission to invade Lithuania and Russia|
Lost support of German princes to Charles IV of Luxembourg
JA_relationships:
Sweden, Eric XII, Son-in-law, img/sweden/eric_xii.jpg|
Holland, William I, Father-in-law, img/dutch/william_i_count_of_hainaut.png

name: Charles IV
JA_events:
Crowned King of the Romans during the reign of Louis IV|
Established Imperial succession in Golden Bull of 1356|
JA_relationships:
France, John II, Brother-in-law, img/france/john_ii.jpg|
England, Richard II, Son-in-law, img/england/richard_ii.jpg|
Hungary, Louis I, Son-in-law, img/hungary/louis_i.jpg

name: Sigismund
JA_events:
Founded the Order of the Dragon to fight the Turks|
Ended Papal Schism through the Council of Constance|
Had Jan Hus executed after promising safe passage
JA_relationships: Hungary, Louis I, Father-in-law, img/hungary/louis_i.jpg

name: Frederick III
JA_events:
Last Emperor to be crowned in Rome|
Consolidated ancestral Habsburg land of Austria and Hungary
JA_relationships: Portugal, Edward I, Father-in-law, img/portugal/edward_i.jpg

name: Maximilian I
JA_events:
Proclaimed Emperor-elect at Trent|
Lost Swiss territories to Swiss Confederacy|
Established Habsburg dynasty in Spain via son's marriage to queen of Castile
JA_relationships:
Burgundy, Charles the Bold, Father-in-law, img/france/charles_the_bold.jpg|
Brittany, Anne, Wife, img/france/anne_of_brittany.jpg|
Castile, Philip I, Son, img/spain/philip_i.jpg

name: Charles V
JA_events:
Financed conquistadores for Incan and Aztec expeditions|
Organized Diet of Worms to halt the Protestant Reformation|
Divided empire between Spanish and Austrian Habsburgs
JA_relationships:
Spain, Philip II, Son, img/spain/philip_ii.jpg|
Portugal, Manuel I, Father-in-law, img/portugal/manuel_i.jpg|
Portugal, Sebastian, Grandson, img/portugal/sebastian.png

name: Ferdinand I
JA_events:
Consolidated grasp over Hungary|
Led Counter-Reformation, the Catholic response to Protestantism
JA_relationships:
Hungary, Vladislaus II, Father-in-law, img/hungary/vladislaus_ii.jpg|
Poland, Sigismund II Augustus, Son-in-law, img/poland/sigismund_ii_augustus.jpg

name: Maximilian II
JA_events:
Established temporary peace with Protestants during the Confessionalization|
Failed to evict Ottoman Turks from Hungary
JA_relationships:
Spain, Maria, Wife & Cousin, img/spain/maria_of_austria.jpg|
France, Charles IX, Son-in-law, img/france/charles_ix.jpg

name: Rudolf II
JA_events:
Ineffectual ruler whose mistakes led to the Thirty Years' War|
Influential patron of Northern Mannerist art|
Intellectual devotee who helped seed the scientific revolution

name: Matthias
JA_events:
Gave freedom of religion to the Dutch in Union of Utrecht|
Imprisoned and stripped brother Rudolf II of all titles and land|
Imprisoned Protestant leader Klesl during Bohemian Protestant revolt

name: Ferdinand II
JA_events:
A zealous Catholic, led the Thirty Years' War against Protestants|
Put down Bohemian revolt led by Protestant Emperor Frederick V|
Ended civil war component by signing Peace of Prague in 1635
JA_relationships: Florence, Eleanor de' Medici, Mother-in-law, img/italy/eleanor_de_medici.jpg

name: Ferdinand III
JA_events:
Appointed head of the Imperial army during Thirty Years' War|
Made peace with Protestant league in 1648 with Peace of Westphalia
JA_relationships:
Spain, Maria Anna, Wife & Cousin, img/spain/maria_anna.jpg|
Spain, Philip IV, Brother-in-law & Son-in-law, img/spain/philip_iv.jpg|
Poland, Michael I, Son-in-law, img/poland/michael_i.jpg

name: Leopold I
JA_events:
Received all of Kingdom of Hungary from Turks|
Challenged the will of Spanish Charles II leaving Spain to France
JA_wars:
Great Turkish War, 1683-99|
Nine Years' War, 1688-97|
War of the Spanish Succession
JA_relationships:
France, Louis XIV, Cousin, img/france/louis_xiv.jpg|
Spain, Margaret Theresa, Wife & Cousin, img/spain/margaret_theresa.jpg|
Portugal, John V, Son-in-law, img/portugal/john_v.jpg

name: Joseph I
JA_events: Re-established Austrian hegemony over Italy
JA_relationships: Poland, Augustus III, Son-in-law, img/poland/augustus_iii.png

name: Charles VI
JA_events:
Issued Pragmatic Sanction of 1713 establishing daughter Maria Theresa heiress|
Ceded overseas trading company in exchange for foreign recognition|
Upon death, recognition was reneged, leading to War of the Austrian Succession

name: Charles VII
JA_events:
Elected Holy Roman Emperor over Maria Theresa through Salic Law|
Overrun by Austrian Habsburg-Lorraine troops and fled to Frankfurt|
Posthumously recognized by Habsburgs as Holy Roman Emperor
JA_relationships: Poland, John III, Grandfather, img/poland/john_iii.jpg

name: Francis I
JA_events:
Won the War of Austrian Succession with Habsburg wife Maria Theresa|
Pursued business while wife managed the affairs of the Empire
JA_wars:
War of the Austrian Succession|
Seven Years' War, 1756-63
JA_relationships: France, Marie Antoinette, Daughter, img/france/marie_antoinette.jpg

name: Joseph II
JA_events:
Valuing the Enlightenment, unsuccessfully attempted reforms|
Passed 1783 Edict of Tolerance giving some freedom of religion|
Opposed by Hungarian nobles and died ruined and abandoned
JA_relationships:
France, Louis XV, Father-in-law, img/france/louis_xv.jpg|
France, Louis XVI, Brother-in-law, img/france/louis_xvi.jpg

name: Leopold II
JA_events:
Publicly vowed to intervene in French Revolution in 1791|
Contested for power over Hungary with King of Prussia|
Contested for power over Poland with Catherine the Great
JA_relationships:
France, Louis XVI, Brother-in-law, img/france/louis_xvi.jpg|
Spain, Charles III, Father-in-law, img/spain/charles_iii.jpg|
Sardinia, Charles Albert, Son-in-law, img/italy/charles_albert.jpg

name: Francis II
JA_events:
Defeated by Napoleon at the Battle of Austerlitz|
Founded the Austrian Empire, becoming its first Emperor|
Served as first president of German Confederation in 1815
JA_wars:
War of the 2nd Coalition, 1798-1802|
War of the 3rd Coalition, 1803-6|
War of the 6th Coalition, 1813-4

France, Napoleon I, Son-in-law, img/france/napoleon_i.jpg|
